type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.  LICENSING OF PREMISES
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Interpretation.  LICENSING OF PREMISES  2. In this Act  alcohol means ethyl alcohol;  Commissioner means the Commissioner- General of the Revenue Authority appointed under the Revenue Authority Act  and includes CHAPTER 82:23  BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT  LAWS OF GUYANA Bitters and Cordials Cap. 82:23 5  L.R.O. 1/2012       c. 65:01                                       Application for licence for manufacture of  (a) any officer of the Revenue Authority acting in the performance of his duties;  (b)     any mines officer within the meaning of the Mining Act authorised in writing by the Commissioner  to perform any of the functions conferred on the Commissioner  by this Act; and  (c) any district commissioner authorised in writing by the Commissioner  to perform any of the functions conferred on the Commissioner  by this Act;  compound means any bitters, or cordials, or sweets, or other thing, in the manufacture whereof spirits, whether distilled or not distilled, are combined with any other ingredient;  compounder means anyone licensed to manufacture any compound; licensed premises means any house, building, yard, or other place in respect of which a licence is issued under this Act;  spirits means spirits of any description;  sweets means any liquor made from fruit and sugar, or from fruit mixed with any other material, which has undergone a process of fermentation in the manufacture thereof and which contains more than two decimal three per cent and less than fourteen decimal eight per cent of alcohol, and includes Guyanese wines and cider.  LICENSING OF PREMISES

type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Application for licence for manufacture of sweets or compound. 3. (1) Anyone who desires to manufacture any sweets or compound shall make application in writing signed by LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 82:23 Bitters and Cordials  L.R.O. 1/2012 sweets or compound. type.name: section
type.title: Restrictions on issue of licences.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Restrictions on issue of licences. 4. (1) Except with the sanction of the Minister, no licence shall be issued under this Act in respect of any premises situate elsewhere than in the City of Georgetown or the town of New Amsterdam.  (2) No licence shall be issued under this Act in respect of any premises situate within fifty yards of premises used for the purpose of selling spirits by retail.  (3) All licensed premises shall be fenced or enclosed to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, and shall be provided with the modes of ingress or egress directed by him.

type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under General provisions relating to licences. 5. (1) Every licence issued under this Act shall be issued and signed by the Commissioner, and shall be in such form and contain such particulars as he from time to time thinks fit.  (2) Every licence shall terminate on the last day of the financial year in which it is issued.  (3) Any licence may for sufficient cause be cancelled or suspended by the Minister for any time he thinks fit.  (4) There shall be payable for the licence the sum, if any, from time to time fixed by the National Assembly. type.title: Manufacturer’s security.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Manufacturers security. 6. Before any licence is issued to a manufacturer of sweets or compounder under this Act he shall enter into a bond for the amount and with the sureties approved by the Minister, conditioned for the proper  carrying out, during the term of the licence or any renewal thereof, of the provisions of this Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Memorandum of change in manufacturers, or articles for manufacture.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Memorandum of change in manufacturers, or articles for manufacture. 7. (1) Where a change in the persons or firm carrying on the business of a manufacturer of sweets or compounder takes place by death, retirement, admission of a new partner, or otherwise, a memorandum thereof shall be delivered by the person carrying on that business within ten days next after the change has taken place; and at the expiration of the ten days, if the memorandum has not been delivered, everyone engaged in carrying on the business shall on conviction be liable to a fine of one thousand dollars for every day during which the business is carried on.  (2) Where a change takes place in respect of any room, place, vessel, or utensil described in the application of a manufacturer of sweets or compounder, a memorandum thereof shall be delivered to the Commissioner by the manufacturer of sweets or compounder within ten days next after the change has taken place; and in default the manufacturer of sweets or compounder shall be liable to the penalty last aforesaid.

Where a change takes place in respect of any room, place, vessel, or utensil described in the application of a manufacturer of sweets or compounder, a memorandum thereof shall be delivered to the Commissioner by the manufacturer of sweets or compounder within ten days next after the change has taken place; and in default the manufacturer of sweets or compounder shall be liable to the penalty last aforesaid.

type.name: section
type.title: Improperly carrying on manufacture.  RECEIPT OF SPIRITS
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Improperly carrying on manufacture.  RECEIPT OF SPIRITS  9. Everyone who  (a)   not being a manufacturer of sweets or compounder, carries on, or is in any way concerned in carrying on, the manufacture of any sweets or compound; or  (b) being a manufacturer of sweets or compounder, carries on, or is in any way concerned in carrying on, the manufacture of any sweets or compound otherwise than in accordance with the terms of his licence and the provisions of this Act,  shall be liable to a fine of fifteen thousand dollars. type.name: section
type.title: Removal of sweets or compound.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Removal of sweets or compound. 11. No sweets or compound manufactured in any licensed premises shall be removed therefrom except on a permit first granted and signed by the Commissioner on a request note signed by the manufacturer of sweets or compounder or his agent, specifying the numbers of the boxes or packages containing the sweets or compound, and the contents, in litres of each box or package, and if the sweets  or compound is to be consumed in Guyana, the name and residence of the person to whom it is to  be sent out, and, if it is to be exported or warehoused for exportation, the name of the vessel by which it is to be exported or of the warehouse at  which it is to be warehoused for exportation.

type.title: Form of permit for removal.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Form of permit for removal. 12. (1) The permit shall be made to correspond in respect of the particulars hereinbefore mentioned with the request note on which it is granted, and a reasonable time shall be limited and specified in the permit within which it is to be in force, and no permit shall be valid or of any effect if it is granted on a request note not made in conformity with this Act.  (2) All spirits or sweets or compounds received into or sent out of any licensed premises without, or not in accordance with, the permit aforesaid, together with the casks, vessels, and other packages containing them, and all boats and other vessels, and the horses and other cattle and carriages used in their removal or conveyance, shall be forfeited and may be seized by the Commissioner or any police constable.

(2) If the Commissioner is not immediately admitted into the licensed premises after having so demanded admittance, he, or anyone acting in his aid or assistance, at all times as well by night (if in the presence of a constable) as by day, may break open by force any of the doors or windows, or break through any of the walls, palings, or fences, of the premises, in order to enter them.

type.name: section
type.title: Possession of more than four decimal five litres of liquor, containing more than two decimal three percent of alcohol for which licence required.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Possession of more than four decimal five litres of liquor, containing more than two decimal three percent of alcohol for which licence required. 22. Anyone who without taking out a licence makes, or manufactures, or deals in, or has in his possession, any quantity greater than four decimal five litres of any liquor containing more than two decimal three percent of alcohol, for the making or manufacture, or dealing in, or possession of which he is required to take out a licence, shall be liable for each offence to a fine of fifteen thousand dollars.

type.name: section
type.title: Saving as to manufacture of compound by retail spirit dealers.
type.context: BITTERS AND CORDIALS ACT under Saving as to manufacture of compound by retail spirit dealers. 27. (1) Nothing in this Act shall affect any existing right or practice of a retail spirit dealer to manufacture on his business premises any compound for use for the purpose of mixing with spirits to be consumed on those premises.   (2) Any retail spirit dealer, or anyone in his employment, who  (a) manufactures any compound for use for any other purpose than that of mixing with spirits, whether diluted or not, to be consumed on his business premises; or  (b) sells or delivers to anyone any compound manufactured by him otherwise than when mixed with spirits, whether diluted or not, to be consumed on his business premises,  (3) The Commissioner, at any reasonable time during the day, may enter into the business premises of any retail spirit dealer for the purpose of satisfying himself that this section is not being contravened, and section 19(2), mutatis mutandis, shall apply.
